subject: Real Estate
title: Medieval Commons and Enclosure
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Medieval Commons and Enclosure.

hook.text: For centuries, English villagers shared open fields and forests. No fences, no private plots.

buildup.text: Families grazed cattle, gathered firewood, and farmed strips of common land side by side.

discovery.text: Then wealthy landowners began 'enclosing' commons â€” fencing them off as private property.

twist.text: Peasants who depended on shared land were evicted. Entire villages emptied to make room for sheep.

climax.text: Enclosure created modern private ownership but displaced millions into cities and factories.

punchline.text: Private property was born by fencing out the poor.

quiz.question: What was 'enclosure' in medieval England?
options: Fencing off common land as private property
